title: Attopedia for Android Wear
summary: The world's knowledge on the back of your hand  |  Encyclopedia for Android Wear

descriptionHTML:
For Android Wear devices ONLY.
This is a free, open-source application for browsing Wikipedia content in an effort to make the world's information more accessible from smart watches.

Currently supports English only. Support for other languages will come in future releases.

by Dheera Venkatraman
http://dheera.net/

Content sourced from Wikipedia under the Creative Commons CC-BY-SA 3.0 License
https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/

Project page and source code:
http://dheera.net/projects/android-attopedia

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program. If not, see .
comments: Mildly frustrating It's hard to see more than a sentence or two at a time.  Why format the text so it only fills half of a tiny watch screen??  Would be 5 stars if the text would fill the screen.  This would also benefit from a history (list of recently searched subjects) and maybe a small cache (to save battery by not having to xfer the same material a 2nd time).

Not quite complete. AFTER UPDATE STILL GIVES  UNABLE TO CONNECT MESSAGE...Completes voice search of intended article, but then gives a connection error, and freezes, every time...... LG Urbane. If updated and corrected, then yes, it would be a solid app.

Resolved fantastic app! The best Smartwatch I have seen on any OS. Great info right on your wrist!  My only complaint is that there are large borders (a lot of wasted screen space) when you get to reading the text. UPDATE - Connection issue resolved! Thank you, Dheera! On my Sony Smartwatch 3 I keep receiving a connection failed message trying to load more info after initial search

I get this message every time, even though I can connect with other apps. Not sure if it's an issue with the brand new version of wear or what...Moto 360  EDIT: Switched to a Galaxy S6 and all Android wear apps I've had an issue with, are no longer an issue.  Thanks!
Search fails It recognizes my voice search then fails to fetch the information. Basically never leaving the screen that says tap to search. (Using Moto 360 Gen 1)
Connection Failed Gives me "connection failed" message when i press on any article to open it. Liked the concept but it's useless for me because of this bug.
recentChanges: Optimized display for both square and round layouts
Fixed connection issues on numerous devices
